content:
• Friday, April 8, 2016
  • JMG

    Gannett closes $280M buyout of Journal Media Group

    • Gannett (GCI +1.7%) has closed its $280M buyout of Journal Media Group (NYSE:JMG), effective as of 11:59 tonight ET.
    • The company had won antitrust approval yesterday and JMG shareholders had approved the deal on March 1.
    • Gannett acquires 15 daily newspapers and their related digital assets, resulting in a combined operation of 107 dailies in 34 states and Guam to go along with its national USA Today, and the UK's Newsquest and its 150 local news brands.
    • JMG stock rose 0.7% to finish at $12.01 (vs. the deal price of $12/share); it suspends trading with the closing and will be delisted from the NYSE.
    • Now read Why Gannett's Acquisition Of Journal Media Group Makes Strong Financial & Strategic Sense »
     
     
     
     
    | 6:16 PM | 1 Comment

  • After Hours Gainers / Losers

    • Top gainers, as of 5.25 p.m.: SEAC +3.1%. LIFE +2.5%. BSBR +2.2%. CFX +1.6%. CLVS +1.1%.
    • Top losers, as of 5.25p.m.: MTW -4.6%. BVN -2.7%. DEPO -2.4%. PBF -1.3%. MYL -1.0%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:40 PM

  • Weekly ETF Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: BNO +8.14%. VXX +7.94%. USO +7.5%. GDXJ +7.25%. OIL +7.07%.
    • Losers: GAZ -5.45%. EWA -3.23%. ILF -3.11%. EPI -2.92%. XLF -2.91%.  
     
     
     
     
    | 4:30 PM | 1 Comment
  • TRP

    TransCanada wins Mexico pipeline auction; Sempra disqualified

    • TransCanada (TRP +2.9%) wins an auction to develop and operate a natural gas pipeline in central Mexico, beating a subsidiary of Sempra Energy (SRE +0.6%) that was disqualified from bidding.
    • TRP unit Transportadora de Gas Natural de la Huasteca wins the auction with a $336M bid, despite TRP's plans to sell as much as 49% of its Mexican assets.
    • Meanwhile, a bid from SRE's Ienova unit was thrown out for the third time since mid-March for failing to meet requirements to operate the pipeline.
    • The 261-mile pipeline project is expected to begin operation in early 2018.
    • Now read Keystone pipeline spill in South Dakota bigger than first thought
     
     
     
     
    | 3:28 PM | 7 Comments
  • APA

    Apache upgraded at Wells Fargo on balance sheet strength

    • Apache (APA +2.8%) enjoys a strong gain after Wells Fargo upgrades shares to Outperform from Market Perform, citing a favorable view of its balance sheet and international assets the firm thinks will allow the company to outperform if commodity prices continue to be weak.
    • Wells believes APA will be able to finance additional growth and exploration if commodity prices rally.
    • The firm says recent meetings with new management suggest APA can leverage its strong balance sheet and turn the business around.
    • Now read Why you should be long Apache
     
     
     
     
    | 3:14 PM | 1 Comment
  • PBF

    PBF Energy is J.P. Morgan's top refining pick

    • PBF Energy (PBF +3.9%) is J.P. Morgan's favorite stock among oil refiners, initiating coverage of the company with an Overweight rating and $40 price target.
    • "PBF checks all of the boxes we look for around valuation on both sum-of-the-parts and sustaining [free cash flow] yield, [and] it has flexible pro forma balance sheet metrics that leave room for additional opportunities,” the firm says.
    • The firm expects solid upside for PBF following the inexpensive acquisitions of Chalmette and Torrance.
    • JPM also notes that PBF owns a 54% LP stake in its PBF Logistics midstream subsidiary, which is expected to generate pro forma EBITDA of $145M in 2017.
    • Now read Wells Fargo's three oil refiners with the most upside: Valero, PBF, Delek
     
     
     
     
    | 2:45 PM | 1 Comment
  • WR

    Bloomberg: Westar attracts takeover interest from Ameren, Canadian funds

    • Westar Energy (WR +2.3%) moves higher after a brief trading halt, following a Bloomberg report that the Kansas electric utility is getting interest from buyers.
    • Ameren (AEE -0.1%), which provides electrical transmission and natural gas delivery to 3M-plus customers in Missouri and Illinois, reportedly is interested, as well as an investor consortium that includes Borealis Infrastructure Management and the Canada Pension Plan Investment Board.
    • Initial bids for WR, which has a ~$7B market cap, are due next week, according to the report.
    • Now read Westar Energy +7% as it reportedly talks to potential buyers
     
     
     
     
    | 2:09 PM | 3 Comments
  • BHGE

    Baker Hughes downgraded to Underperform from Buy at Jefferies

    • Analysts are split on Baker Hughes' (BHI +4.3%) future if its merger with Halliburton (HAL +4.4%) fails, but Jefferies squarely comes down on the side of pessimism, downgrading BHI to Underperform from Buy while saying the DoJ lawsuit and scrutiny from other world regulators make the acquisition very unlikely.
    • The DoJ lawsuit is "daunting," Jefferies says, and even if HAL-BHI prevails, the merger may be unable to clear regulatory resistance elsewhere in the world, and an aggressive share buyback or quick acquisition by another company is not likely.
    • Analysts at Wells Fargo, Citigroup and FBR are among those still optimistic toward BHI even without a tie-up, but Deutsche Bank, Evercore ISI and Jefferies not so much (I, II, III, IV).
    • Now read Including a $3.5 billion breakup fee, Baker Hughes is worth $20
     
     
     
     
    | 1:45 PM

  • Midday Gainers/ Losers

    • Gainers: HGSH +34%. STDY +37%. DLTH +23%. AFOP +19%. LEI +19%. ANFI +18%. DNR +15%. HLX +15%. DSX +14%. GGB +14%.
    • Losers: VKTX -39%. SEAC -31%. MNKD -16%. BOOT -16%. OTC:MDSY -14%. GPS -14%. RT -14%. RECN -11%. TTPH -11%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM | 7 Comments
  • VALE

    Samarco must stop leaks before operations resume, Brazil officials say

    • The Samarco joint venture between Vale (VALE +8.7%) and BHP Billiton (BHP +4.2%) will not receive government authorization to resume iron ore mining operations at the site of November's tailings dam burst until all leaks are stopped, Brazilian environmental protection officials tell Reuters.
    • The restart depends on authorization from the Minas Gerais state environmental agency, which says Samarco needs to find a solution for the leaks from dikes built after the dam burst.
    • Samarco hopes to resume operations at the start of Q1 to help pay for a 20B real ($5.53B) damages settlement.
    • Now read What the capex cut means for Vale investors
     
     
     
     
    | 12:44 PM | 23 Comments
  • DTEGY

    Deutsche Telekom may import T-Mobile U.S. strategy to Netherlands

    • Deutsche Telekom (OTCQX:DTEGY +0.5%) may take a cue from its customer-stealing U.S. business for its unit in the Netherlands, and reformulate strategy more like T-Mobile US (TMUS -0.8%).
    • That would mean an emphasis on disruption and perhaps a similar focus on mobile rather than fixed service. In contrast to T-Mobile's U.S. operation, the Dutch business has been losing customers over the past three years, and with a longtime presence in the market, it isn't ripe for reinvention.
    • Other, smaller players like Tele2 have actually claimed the mantle of aggression on price in the Netherlands, while there's hot competition from the recently combined Vodafone (VOD +2.3%)/Liberty Global (LBTYA +1.6%) there, as well as Royal KPN (OTCPK:KKPNY -2.3%).
    • DT had floated a sale of T-Mobile Netherlands, but withdrew it as a possibility in February after terms from two bidders didn't rise to its expectations.
    • Now read T-Mobile: The Price Of Peace With YouTube Is High »
     
     
     
     
    | 12:41 PM | 3 Comments
  • EGO

    Eldorado Gold upgraded at Credit Suisse

    • Eldorado Gold (EGO +6.2%) is upgraded to Outperform from Neutral with a $4 price target, raised from $3.25, at Credit Suisse, which sees gold prices supported by ETFs through macro factors such as a more dovish Fed, central bank buying, physical demand and declining supply.
    • EGO has underperformed over the last 15 months, so Credit Suisse thinks negative drivers such as Greece headwinds, a 2016 production decline and reserve declines and subsequent writedowns are priced in.
    • The firm believes that in addition to EGO’s robust production and growing base, several positive catalysts could be ahead, including rising gold prices, EIA approval for Skouries, Skouries development being restarted and maximization of the value of the company’s Chinese assets.
    • Now read Barrick Gold upgraded at Credit Suisse
     
     
     
     
    | 12:23 PM | 1 Comment
  • GOLD

    Barrick Gold upgraded at Credit Suisse

    • Barrick Gold (ABX +4.7%) is upgraded to Outperform from Neutral with a $17 price target, raised from $11, at Credit Suisse, which sees ABX as ideally positioned to capture gold leverage because of its capital allocation strategy.
    • Credit Suisse says ABX’s commitment to a 15% return on invested capital is differentiated in the gold sector and positions the miner to effectively capture the leverage through prudent deployment of cash flow that would accrue during a period of higher gold prices.
    • The firm also says ABX is on track to reduce its debt to a more manageable $8B target by year-end 2016 from $10B at year-end 2015 and $13B, and a higher gold price could accelerate the process.
    • The firm sees ABX's net asset value multiple at 2x vs. Goldcorp (GG +2.5%) at 1.75x and Newmont Mining (NEM +4.1%) at 1.80x to "reflect the preference of newer investors in the gold space for a turnaround story with demonstrated leverage to gold price."
    • Now read Barrick earnings: No surprises
     
     
     
     
    | 11:57 AM | 7 Comments
  • BHP

    Australia ups iron ore price forecast, sees low-cost miners expanding share

    • Australia is bullish about iron ore prices for the next five years, raising its iron ore forecast to an average $45/metric ton in 2016 from a December outlook for $41.30.
    • As high-cost miners close, Australian producers will boost shipments, and prices will rise to $56/metric ton next year, $61.40 in 2018 and $64.70 in 2021, Australia’s Department of Industry, Innovation & Science says in its quarterly outlook.
    • Iron ore's surprise YTD price rebound has swayed few skeptics, with Goldman Sachs and others reiterating bearish forecasts, but Australia projects that its giant low-cost producers BHP Billiton (BHP +4%) and Rio Tinto (RIO +4%), together with Brazil’s Vale (VALE +7.3%), will claim a greater share of global trade and prices will climb.
    • Now read Iron ore exports from Australia's Port Hedland expand to record
     
     
     
     
    | 11:48 AM | 3 Comments
  • CME

    CME Group lower as BM&F Bovespa exits stake

    • The Brazilian markets operator has sold its 4% stake in CME Group (CME -2.7%) in order to raise funds for a potential purchase of rival Cetip.
    • Source: FT
    • The 13.6M share sale netted about $1.3B for Bovespa.
    • A combination of Bovespa and Cetip would create a near-$11B company, and entrench Bovespa as the largest exchanges operator in Latin America. It would also be a windfall for IntercontinentalExchange (ICE -0.1%), a 12.5% owner of Cetip.
    • Yesterday's sale brings an end to a near decade-long cross-shareholding agreement between Bovespa and CME, and Bovespa CEO Edemir Pinto has resigned from the CME board. CME continues to hold its stake in Bovespa.
    • Now read: CME Group: Where Is The Creativity? Dump The Stock
     
     
     
     
    | 11:17 AM
  • SGYP

    Synergy Pharma the latest rumored buyout; shares up 6%

    • Micro cap Synergy Pharmaceuticals (SGYP +5.5%) jumps on average volume in response to the rumor that management is mulling a sale of the company. It needs to do something. Shares have lost ~70% of their value since last summer.
    • The company's lead product candidate is constipation med plecanatide, currently under FDA review (NDA was submitted in January).
    • Read now Synergy Pharmaceuticals: FDA Decision Play 
     
     
     
     
    | 11:14 AM | 26 Comments
  • ANFI

    Amira Nature Foods flies with earnings dates on the calendar

    • Amira Nature Foods (ANFI +12.7%) spikes after the company announces that it plans to release interim six-month financial results for the period ending September 30 sometime this month.
    • The company aims to disclose results for the six months ending on March 31 in July.
    • There's been plenty of controversy over Amira's accounting and financial numbers, with some it stirred up by SA contributor Prescience Point.
    • Now read Amira's Wonderful Growth Story Continues
     
     
     
     
    | 10:56 AM | 2 Comments
  • TRP

    Keystone pipeline spill in South Dakota bigger than first thought

    • TransCanada (TRP +2%) says ~400 barrels of oil leaked near the Keystone pipeline in South Dakota, far more than the 125 barrels the company originally estimated.
    • TRP still has not said what caused the leak, which was reported Saturday; it does say the leak poses no threat to the environment or to public health.
    • The company reportedly has told customers the pipeline will remain closed until early next week.
    • The shutdown contributed to a drop of more than 480K barrels at the Cushing, Okla., delivery point for U.S. crude futures in the five days to Tuesday, according to Genscape data.
    • Now read Spending in Canada's energy sector suffers record drop
     
     
     
     
    | 10:36 AM | 5 Comments
  • LULU

    Apparel stocks slumping after latest Gap misfire

    • Apparel stocks are getting hammered after Gap's latest monthly sales dud creates a new ripple of worry.
    • There's a little bit of a failed feedback loop going on in the sector as teenagers/young adults skip mall visits to spend on other categories while sellers try to innovate their way out of the box. That innovation is leading to excess inventory which in turn leads to more painful discounting
    • Decliners include Lululemon (LULU -1.7%), Kate Spade (KATE -1.4%), Deckers Outdoor (DECK -2.5%), Coach (COH -1.6%), Michael Kors (KORS -2.1%), Columbia Sportswear (COLM -1.8%), Carter's (CRI -1.8%), Hanesbrands (HBI -1.3%), Ascena Retail (ASNA -3.9%), Nordstrom (JWN -3.4%), Chico's FAS (CHS -4.2%), Abercrombie & Fitch (ANF -4%), Urban Outfitters (URBN -2.6%), L Brands (LB -3%), Express (EXPR -2.4%), Guess (GES -2.9%), Tailored Brands (TLRD -1.9%) and Zumiez (ZUMZ -2.8%).
    • Now read Sell Your Apparel Stocks 
     
     
     
     
    | 10:17 AM
  • BPOP

    Puerto Rico banks find a sell-side friend

    • Piper Jaffray finds value in the roughed-up names as it starts coverage on both Popular (BPOP +1.4%) and First Bancorp (FBP +4.7%) with an Overweight rating.
    • On a year-over-year basis, FBP is down 58%, and BPOP 23%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:03 AM | 2 Comments
  • DLTH

    Huge pop for Duluth Holdings, here's who called it

    • Duluth Holdings (DLTH +16.7%) shoots higher after Q4 results top estimates.
    • Margin rates were higher during the quarter as strong sales helped to lever down costs.
    • Looking ahead, the company expects revenue of $370M to $380M for FY16 vs. $356M consensus and adjusted EBITDA of $40M to $42.5M.
    • Shares of Duluth set a post-IPO high of $21.20.
    • SA contributor Cory Cramer called out the upside on Duluth in January back when shares were in the $17 range. On Wall Street, only the lead underwriters were recommending that investors snap up shares.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:03 AM | 4 Comments
  • ALLY

    Ally Financial lower after downgrade

    • Ally Financial (ALLY -1.1%) continues to give ground following its entry into the wealth management business earlier this week (its agreement to purchase TradeKing).
    • Bank of America bails, downgrading to Neutral from Buy. There's no detail on the reasoning, but also maybe at work are rising losses in subprime auto ABS.
    • Earlier: Deutsche says concern over the TradeKing purchase is overblown
    • Now read: A Look At Ally's Loan Book
     
     
     
     
    | 9:58 AM
  • NBL

    Noble Energy to abandon Gulf of Mexico well

    • Noble Energy (NBL +1.6%) says it will abandon and plug its Silvergate exploration well in the Gulf of Mexico after drilling failed to find commercial hydrocarbons.
    • NBL also says it expects its overall Q1 exploration expense to come in toward the higher end of its previous guidance of $130M-$170M.
    • However, NBL shares open higher along with other energy companies, as crude oil prices surge ~5% on a surprise decline in oil stocks and renewed optimism over a proposed freeze in oil production.
    • Now read Noble Energy still a Buy at Stifel following Israel Supreme Court ruling
     
     
     
     
    | 9:56 AM | 1 Comment
  • TEF

    Telefonica +2.8%; names Pallete new chairman, CEO

    • Telefonica (NYSE:TEF) is up 2.8% early today, after naming Jose Maria Alvarez-Pallete as its new chairman and CEO to follow up on Cesar Alierta's long reign atop the company.
    • Pallete is the first chief executive at the company not named by Spain's government. Alierta announced a surprise resignation last week after 16 years leading the firm.
    • Pallete has been with the company since 1999 and became COO in 2012; his appointment is effective immediately.
    • The board also nominated four new members: Ignacio Cirac, Javier Echenique, Sabina Fluxa and Peter Loscher.
    • Now read Telefonica Dividend Reliant On EU Politics Following Mixed Q4 2015 Results »
     
     
     
     
    | 9:54 AM | 3 Comments
  • GPS

    Alarm bells ringing at Gap

    • Comparable-store sales at Gap (NYSE:GPS) fell for the 12th month in a row in an alarming trend that shows few signs of easing. The 6% drop even caught wary analysts off guard.
    • Although external factors such as mall traffic and weather are in the mix, painful misses with assortment continue to plague the retailer.
    • Is a talent drain to blame? Retail Dive notes that Gap lost Old Navy all-star Stefan Larsson to Ralph Lauren and high-profile creative director Rebekka Bay failed to survive at the company.
    • Fashionista warns about the impact of all that excess inventory heading into the heart of spring.
    • Gap is still registering a 2% YTD gain, despite today's slide.
    • Now read Sell Your Apparel Stocks
     
     
     
     
    | 9:36 AM | 4 Comments
  • VKTX

    Viking Therapeutics prices equity offering; shares plummet 41% premarket

    • Viking Therapeutics (NASDAQ:VKTX) craters 41% premarket on robust volume in response to its announcement of a public offering of 7.5M shares of common stock and warrants to purchase 7.5M shares of common at a price of $1.25 per share and related warrant. The five-year warrants are exercisable at $1.50 per share of stock.
    • Underwriters over-allotment is an additional 1.125M shares of stock and/or warrants to purchase up to an additional 1.125M shares. Closing date is April 8.
    • Yesterday's close was $1.93.
    • Update: Underwriters over-allotment exercised in full.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:21 AM

    • Losers: VKTX -41%. SEAC -21%. RT -16%. GPS -8%.

  • CLVS

    Ad Comm approaches for Clovis lung cancer candidate rociletinib; briefing doc raises questions on efficacy and safety

    • The FDA's Oncologic Drugs Advisory Committee will meet on Tuesday, April 12 to discuss Clovis Oncology's (NASDAQ:CLVS) New Drug Application (NDA) seeking approval of rociletinib for the treatment of patients with epidermal growth factor receptor (EGFR)-positive non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC).
    • Based on the FDA's briefing document, a positive vote is far from certain. For example, the objective response rate (ORR), based on pooled data for the 500 mg, 625 mg and 750 mg dosage arms, was 30%, far short of AstraZeneca's (NYSE:AZN) Tagrisso (osimertinib) which showed a 59% ORR in clinical studies. Also, rociletinib's safety profile is concerning. In a pooled analysis, the most common adverse events were diarrhea (55%), nausea (52%), hyperglycemia (58%) and fatigue (44%). Serious adverse events (grade 3 or higher) were reported in 44% of patients receiving the 500 mg dose. 51% of patients (all dosages) had one or more dose reductions due to adverse events (40% of the 500 mg cohort). The incidence of adverse events in clinical studies for Tagrisso was no more than 25% for most (diarrhea: 42%, rash: 41%, dry skin: 31%).
    • Investors appear unconcerned. Shares are up 2% premarket on robust volume.
    • FDA briefing doc 
    • Errata to FDA briefing doc
    • Company briefing doc 
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM | 25 Comments

  • Loonie flies on strong jobs numbers

    • Canada added 41K jobs in March vs. estimates for just 10K. The unemployment rate fell to 7.1% from 7.3%. Putting some perspective on that 40K number, employment in Canada is higher by 130K for the entire year ending in March.
    • The loonie (NYSEARCA:FXC) is higher by 1% and buying $0.7670.
    • ETFs: EWC, CNDA, EWCS, FCAN, QCAN, HEWC
    • Now read: A Good Time To Buy The 'Big 5' Canadian Bank Stocks (March 31)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:41 AM | 4 Comments
  • AKS

    AK Steel, U.S. Steel downgraded to Sell at UBS

    • AK Steel (NYSE:AKS) -2.2% premarket and U.S. Steel (NYSE:X) -1.3% after shares are downgraded to Sell from Neutral at UBS.
    • The firm is concerned about "balance sheet deterioration over time" at AKS, which needs to manage its high cost base and track record of “sustained ongoing cash burn."
    • UBS sees "a decent likelihood" that AKS could roll its 2018 secured notes, but without a more meaningful escalation of free cash flow, it also sees a possibility that more meaningful liquidity issues could be encountered in 2019.
    • UBS says U.S. Steel is unlikely to generate sustainable free cash flow given its steel price forecast, saying that while cost controls and reductions in working capital have helped X’s cash flow position, the improvements would diminish over time, leaving the company in a “long-term cash burn position.”
    • Now read Major steel players set for better 2017, J.P. Morgan says
     
     
     
     
    | 8:21 AM | 17 Comments
  • ICPT

    Intercept Pharma up 5% premarket after positive Ad Comm vote

    • Intercept Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ICPT) is up 5% premarket on increased volume. Yesterday afternoon, the FDA's Gastrointestinal Drugs Advisory Committee voted 17-0 backing approval of the company's obeticholic acid for the treatment of primary biliary cirrhosis, now called primary biliary cholangitis (PBC). The FDA action date (PDUFA) is May 29.
    • Previously: Ad Comm review approaches for Intercept's lead product candidate (April 5)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:11 AM | 5 Comments
  • AABA

    Yahoo extends bid deadline to April 18

    • Yahoo (YHOO) has moved the deadline for its bids out another week to April 18, writes Re/code’s Kara Swisher.
    • Following a volatile trading session on Thursday, the Internet company's stock is up 1.4% premarket.
    • Now read Starboard's Letter To Yahoo Shareholders
     
     
     
     
    | 7:37 AM | 14 Comments
  • AVXL

    Anavex 3-71 an Orphan Drug for degenerative brain disorder; shares up 16% premarket

    • The FDA designates Anavex Life Sciences' (NASDAQ:AVXL) ANAVEX 3-71 an Orphan Drug for the treatment of Frontotemporal dementia (FTD), a degenerative disorder affecting nerve cells in the brain's frontal (forehead) or temporal (behind the ears) areas. The condition is characterized by a deterioration in behavior and personality, language disturbances and/or changes in muscle or motor functions. FTD affects ~60K Americans and represents ~20% of all dementia cases.
    • According to the company, ANAVEX 3-71 (formerly AF710B) has demonstrated its potential to enhance neuroprotection and cognition in Alzheimer's disease. Its mechanism of action is sigma-1 receptor activation and M1 muscarinic allosteric modulation.
    • Among the benefits of Orphan Drug status is a seven-year period of market exclusivity for the indication, if approved.
    • Shares are up 16% premarket on robust volume.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:30 AM | 10 Comments

  • Bounce in store at the open

    • Global markets are mostly brushing aside yesterday's decline in the States, with the Nikkei and Hong Kong both gaining in Asia, while Shanghai modestly fell. Europe's also in the green - the Stoxx 600 up 0.7% at midday.
    • U.S. stock index futures are higher by 0.6%.
    • The 10-year Treasury yield is up three basis points to 1.72%, gold is down a hair, and oil has rebounded 3.4% to $38.54 per barrel.
    • ETFs: SPY, QQQ, DIA, SH, SSO, VOO, SDS, IVV, SPXU, TQQQ, UPRO, PSQ, SPXL, RSP, SPXS, SQQQ, QID, DOG, QLD, DXD, UDOW, RWL, SDOW, VFINX, EPS, DDM, QQEW, BXUB, QQQE, SPLX, SFLA, BXUC, QQXT, SPUU, LLSP, UDPIX, OTPIX, RYARX
    • Now read: Most Volatile S&P 500 Stocks On Earnings
